com.algonquincollege.cst8284.assignment2.model

Class SeaMonster

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.algonquincollege.cst8284.assignment2.model.Character
      • com.algonquincollege.cst8284.assignment2.model.SeaMonster

  • public class SeaMonster
extends Character
    This class represents a Sea Monster as combat character It is a subclass of the Character class
    Since:
    javac 1.8.0_271
    Author:
    Daniel Pereira Castillo Student number: 041009960 Lab Section 302
    See Also:
    Character

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int attackChance 
      private int seaMonsterHealth
      The instance variables represent the battle stats of the Sea Monster They are calculated via dice rolls from the BonusDiceBag class based on the character set guide seaMonsterHealth represents the current health of the Sea Monster seaMonsterMaxHealth represents the maximum health of the Sea Monster on creation seaMonsterStrength represents the combat strength attackChance represents a random number which is compared against to calculate the chances of a given attack being generated
      private int seaMonsterMaxHealth 
      private int seaMonsterStrength 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SeaMonster()
      This is the no-arg constructor of the SeaMonster class It is chained to SeaMonster (int maxHealth, int currentHealth, int strength)
      SeaMonster(int maxHealth, int currentHealth, int strength)
      This is the parameterized constructor of the SeaMonster class it invokes the parameterized constructor of the superclass The constructor sets the values to those of the Sea Monster

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Attack attack()
      This method overrides the attack() method from the Character class It creates an attack from the Sea Monster An attack damage amount myDamage represents the damage dealt by the SeaMonster Two attacks are instantiated: a Frost attack and a Basic attack If attackChance is less than or equal to 50, a Basic attack is rendered else, a Frost attack is rendered
      AttackReport defend(Attack attack)
      This method overrides the defend() method from the Character class It processes what to do when the Sea Monster is attacked by another character A new AttackReport is instantiated and modified depending on the kind of attack Fire, Basic, and Frost attacks are processed differently and inflict different damage

      • Methods inherited from class com.algonquincollege.cst8284.assignment2.model.Character

        fullRecover, getCurrentHealth, getMaxHealth, getStrength, getTypeClassName, setCurrentHealth, setMaxHealth, setStrength, toString

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • seaMonsterHealth

        private int seaMonsterHealth
        The instance variables represent the battle stats of the Sea Monster They are calculated via dice rolls from the BonusDiceBag class based on the character set guide seaMonsterHealth represents the current health of the Sea Monster seaMonsterMaxHealth represents the maximum health of the Sea Monster on creation seaMonsterStrength represents the combat strength attackChance represents a random number which is compared against to calculate the chances of a given attack being generated

    • Constructor Detail

      • SeaMonster

        public SeaMonster()
        This is the no-arg constructor of the SeaMonster class It is chained to SeaMonster (int maxHealth, int currentHealth, int strength)

      • SeaMonster

        public SeaMonster(int maxHealth,
                  int currentHealth,
                  int strength)
        This is the parameterized constructor of the SeaMonster class it invokes the parameterized constructor of the superclass The constructor sets the values to those of the Sea Monster
        Parameters:
        maxHealth - is the character's maximum health upon creation
        currentHealth - is the character's current health
        strength - is the combat strength of the character

    • Method Detail

      • attack

        public Attack attack()
        This method overrides the attack() method from the Character class It creates an attack from the Sea Monster An attack damage amount myDamage represents the damage dealt by the SeaMonster Two attacks are instantiated: a Frost attack and a Basic attack If attackChance is less than or equal to 50, a Basic attack is rendered else, a Frost attack is rendered
        Specified by:
        attack in class Character
        Returns:
        an Attack
        See Also:
        DiceBag

      • defend

        public AttackReport defend(Attack attack)
        This method overrides the defend() method from the Character class It processes what to do when the Sea Monster is attacked by another character A new AttackReport is instantiated and modified depending on the kind of attack Fire, Basic, and Frost attacks are processed differently and inflict different damage
        Specified by:
        defend in class Character
        Parameters:
        attack - the Attack against this character
        Returns:
        an AttackReport on how this character defended
